title: Here comes more superloads through county the week of Aug. 25-28
description: Motorists are advised of the potential for lengthy delays from the movement of windmill blades and tower and turbine parts.
content:
PennDOT is advising motorists of the potential for lengthy delays from the continued movement of superloads consisting of windmill blades and tower and turbine parts through the PennDOT District 9 counties through mid-September.

Superloads scheduled for Aug. 25-28 will use one of three routes based on cargo.
• None Windmill blade using U.S. 219 in Somerset County beginning at approximately 9 a.m.
• None Windmill blade using U.S. 219 in Somerset County beginning at approximately 11 a.m.
• None Windmill blade using U.S. 219 in Somerset County beginning at approximately 1 p.m.

Route includes U.S. 219 through Somerset County, Route 4031 (Plank Road), U.S. 219 and Route 4013 (Sunset Road), and Route 36 in Cambria County.
• None Windmill blade using U.S. 219 in Somerset County beginning at approximately 9 a.m.
• None Windmill blade using U.S. 219 in Somerset County beginning at approximately 11 a.m.
• None Windmill blade using U.S. 219 in Somerset County beginning at approximately 1 p.m.

Route includes U.S. 219 through Somerset County, Route 4031 (Plank Road), U.S. 219 and Route 4013 (Sunset Road), and Route 36 in Cambria County.

The superloads are destined for the CPV Rogue’s Wind facility near Patton, Cambria County.

Drivers should remain alert for these slow-moving, two-lane operations and use alternate routes when possible. Traveling both the posted speed limit and slower as needed, superloads will occasionally pull over to allow traffic to pass.

This article originally appeared on The Daily American: Superloads continue through county the week of Aug. 25-28
summary: PennDOT is warning motorists of potential delays due to the continued movement of superloads of windmill blades and tower and turbine parts through the PennDOT District 9 counties until mid-September. Superloads scheduled for the week of Aug. 25-28 will use one of three routes based on cargo. The superloads are headed for the CPV Rogue's Wind facility near Patton, Cambria County. Drivers should be aware of these slow-moving operations and use alternate routes.
shortSummary: PennDOT warns of long delays due to ongoing superloads of windmill blades and turbine parts across Somerset and Cumbria.

scraped_sources.text:
Here comes more superloads through county the week of Aug. 25-28
- Multiple superloads are scheduled daily between August 25-28, utilizing routes including US 220, I-99, and US 219.
PennDOT is advising motorists of the potential for lengthy delays from the continued movement of superloads consisting of windmill blades and tower and turbine parts through the PennDOT District 9 counties through mid-September.
Superloads scheduled for Aug. 25-28 will use one of three routes based on cargo.
Aug. 25
- Windmill blade using U.S. 219 in Somerset County beginning at approximately 9 a.m.
- Windmill blade using U.S. 219 in Somerset County beginning at approximately 11 a.m.
- Windmill blade using U.S. 219 in Somerset County beginning at approximately 1 p.m.
Route includes U.S. 219 through Somerset County, Route 4031 (Plank Road), U.S. 219 and Route 4013 (Sunset Road), and Route 36 in Cambria County.
Aug. 28
- Windmill blade using U.S. 219 in Somerset County beginning at approximately 9 a.m.
- Windmill blade using U.S. 219 in Somerset County beginning at approximately 11 a.m.
- Windmill blade using U.S. 219 in Somerset County beginning at approximately 1 p.m.
Route includes U.S. 219 through Somerset County, Route 4031 (Plank Road), U.S. 219 and Route 4013 (Sunset Road), and Route 36 in Cambria County.
The superloads are destined for the CPV Rogue’s Wind facility near Patton, Cambria County.
Drivers should remain alert for these slow-moving, two-lane operations and use alternate routes when possible. Traveling both the posted speed limit and slower as needed, superloads will occasionally pull over to allow traffic to pass.

argos_summary: PennDOT is warning motorists of possible long delays as superloads carrying wind turbine components travel through District 9 counties from August 25‑28 and into mid‑September. The loads will use U.S. 219 and connecting roads (Route 4031, Route 4013, Route 36) to reach the CPV Rogue wind facility near Patton, Cambria County. Drivers are advised to stay alert, keep to posted speed limits, and consider alternate routes when possible, as the two‑lane trucks may pull over to allow traffic to pass.
